policies.name: Security Awareness and Training Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing security literacy training programs, content requirements, frequency, and responsibilities
policies.rationale: NIST 03.02.01 requires 'provide security literacy training' which necessitates formal policy guidance on training programs, content, delivery methods, and organizational roles

procedures.name: Security Awareness Training Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for delivering initial and recurring security literacy training to all system users including managers, executives, and contractors
procedures.rationale: Control requires training 'as part of initial training for new users and organization-defined frequency thereafter' requiring documented procedures for delivery

procedures.name: Insider Threat Awareness Procedure
procedures.description: Process for training users to recognize and report indicators of insider threat including job dissatisfaction, unauthorized access attempts, and policy violations
procedures.rationale: Control 03.02.01.a.3 specifically requires training 'on recognizing and reporting indicators of insider threat'

procedures.name: Social Engineering and Social Mining Awareness Procedure
procedures.description: Process for training users on phishing, pretexting, impersonation, baiting, quid pro quo, and other social engineering tactics
procedures.rationale: Control 03.02.01.a.3 explicitly requires training on 'social engineering and social mining' with detailed examples in NIST discussion

procedures.name: Training Content Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reviewing and updating security literacy training content based on audit findings, incidents, and regulatory changes
procedures.rationale: Control 03.02.01.b requires 'update security literacy training content organization-defined frequency and following organization-defined events'

executionEvidence.name: Annual Security Awareness Training Certificates
executionEvidence.description: Certificates showing: employee name, training completion date, topics covered (acceptable use, CUI handling, insider threat, social engineering), quiz score if applicable, certificate number
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires training 'organization-defined frequency' with annual being industry standard per NIST SP 800-50; 18-month threshold allows grace period while flagging overdue training

executionEvidence.name: New Hire Initial Training Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: new employee name, hire date, initial security training completion date (must be within 30 days of hire), topics covered, acknowledgment signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.02.01.a.1 requires 'as part of initial training for new users' necessitating proof of timely initial training

executionEvidence.name: Phishing Simulation Campaign Results
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: simulation date, number of users tested, click rates, reporting rates, remedial training provided to clickers, trend analysis over time
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion mentions 'measures to test the knowledge level of users' and social engineering training; quarterly simulations align with CIS Controls recommendations

executionEvidence.name: Training Content Update Logs
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: content review date, changes made, reason for update (incident, audit finding, regulatory change), approver, effective date of new content
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.02.01.b requires updates at defined frequency and following events; annual review ensures relevance while event-driven updates address emerging threats

executionEvidence.name: Training Attendance and Completion Reports
executionEvidence.description: Management reports showing: training completion rates by department, overdue training list, trend analysis, identification of non-compliant users requiring follow-up
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing monitoring of training program effectiveness and compliance as required by NIST discussion on organizational determination of training requirements

operationalActivities: Deliver initial security awareness training to all new hires within 30 days
Provide annual refresher training to all system users including executives and contractors
Conduct quarterly phishing simulation campaigns and track results
Provide immediate refresher training following security incidents or near-misses
Update training content annually and when triggered by audit findings or regulatory changes
Train users on recognizing insider threat indicators (unusual access patterns, policy violations, behavioral changes)
Train users on social engineering tactics (phishing, pretexting, impersonation, baiting)
Train users on proper CUI handling and operations security
Track training completion rates and follow up on overdue training
Test user knowledge through quizzes or simulations and provide remedial training as needed

policies.name: Security Awareness and Training Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining roles requiring specialized training, training content requirements, and frequency standards
policies.rationale: NIST 03.02.02 requires 'provide role-based security training' which necessitates formal policy defining which roles need specialized training

policies.name: Role-Based Training Requirements Matrix
policies.description: Document defining specific security roles (system admins, security assessors, developers, procurement) and their required training topics
policies.rationale: Control requires training for 'organization-defined roles and responsibilities' necessitating documented definition of roles and their training needs

procedures.name: Role-Based Security Training Procedure
procedures.description: Process for identifying personnel requiring role-based training, delivering specialized training before access/duties, and scheduling recurring training
procedures.rationale: Control 03.02.02.a requires training 'before authorizing access to the system or CUI, before performing assigned duties' requiring documented pre-access process

procedures.name: Role-Based Training Content Development Procedure
procedures.description: Process for creating and tailoring training content specific to security roles including technical, operational, and management responsibilities
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion requires training 'specifically tailored for assigned duties' including system admins, developers, security assessors, and procurement officials

procedures.name: Role-Based Training Content Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reviewing and updating role-specific training content based on system changes, new threats, and technology evolution
procedures.rationale: Control 03.02.02.b requires 'update role-based training content organization-defined frequency and following organization-defined events'

executionEvidence.name: Role-Based Training Certificates
executionEvidence.description: Certificates showing: employee name, assigned security role, role-specific training completed, completion date, topics covered (technical controls for role), instructor/provider, certificate number
executionEvidence.frequency: Before access granted and annually thereafter
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires training before access and at organization-defined frequency; annual renewal is industry standard per NIST SP 800-50 with 18-month threshold for compliance monitoring

executionEvidence.name: Pre-Access Training Verification Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: employee name, role assignment date, required training completion date, verification that training occurred BEFORE system access granted, approver signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.02.02.a.1 explicitly requires training 'before authorizing access to the system or CUI' necessitating proof of pre-access training

executionEvidence.name: Role-Based Training Content Update Logs
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: training content review date, role(s) affected, updates made, trigger (system change, new threat, scheduled review), approver, effective date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.02.02.b requires updates at defined frequency and following events like system changes; annual baseline ensures relevance

executionEvidence.name: Role Assignment and Training Matrix
executionEvidence.description: Tracking spreadsheet showing: all personnel with security roles, assigned roles, required training for each role, completion status, last training date, next due date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing tracking of role-based training requirements and compliance as required by NIST discussion on comprehensive role-based training programs

executionEvidence.name: System Change-Triggered Training Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: system change implemented, roles affected, training provided to affected personnel before/during change, completion dates, acknowledgment signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.02.02.a.2 requires training 'when required by system changes' necessitating evidence linking training to specific changes

operationalActivities: Identify all security roles requiring specialized training (admins, developers, assessors, procurement, auditors)
Define role-specific training requirements for each security role
Deliver role-based training BEFORE granting system access or CUI access
Provide role-based training BEFORE personnel perform assigned security duties
Deliver annual refresher training to all personnel with security roles
Provide immediate role-based training when system changes affect role responsibilities
Update role-based training content annually to reflect technology and threat evolution
Tailor training content to technical, operational, and management aspects of each role
Include supply chain security training for procurement and acquisition personnel
Cover system-level software security for administrators and developers
Train security assessors on current assessment methodologies and tools
Document all role assignments and track training completion status
Verify training completion before authorizing privileged access

policies.name: Personnel Security Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing personnel screening requirements, risk-based screening levels, and rescreening conditions
policies.rationale: NIST 03.09.01 requires 'screen individuals prior to authorizing access' which necessitates formal policy on screening standards and procedures

policies.name: Background Investigation Policy
policies.description: Policy defining background check requirements based on position sensitivity, access level to CUI, and applicable federal/state regulations
policies.rationale: Control requires screening activities that assess 'conduct, integrity, judgment, loyalty, reliability, and stability' per NIST discussion requiring formal investigation policy

procedures.name: Pre-Employment Screening Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for conducting background checks including employment verification, education verification, criminal history, credit checks for financial positions
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the system' necessitating documented pre-access screening process

procedures.name: Position Risk Categorization Procedure
procedures.description: Process for categorizing positions by sensitivity level and determining appropriate screening depth based on CUI access level
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states screening activities 'reflect applicable federal laws and criteria established for the level of access required' requiring risk-based approach

procedures.name: Rescreening Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic rescreening or event-triggered rescreening based on position changes, security incidents, or time intervals
procedures.rationale: Control 03.09.01.b requires 'rescreen individuals in accordance with organization-defined conditions requiring rescreening'

procedures.name: Elevated Access Screening Procedure
procedures.description: Process for additional screening when individuals require elevated system access or privileged functions
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion mentions screening 'when elevating system access' requiring additional screening for privilege escalation

executionEvidence.name: Background Check Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: candidate name, position applied for, screening level conducted, checks performed (criminal, employment, education, credit), results, adjudication decision, date completed
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires pre-access screening; background checks older than 12 months may not reflect current trustworthiness per federal personnel security guidelines

executionEvidence.name: Screening Adjudication Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: individual screened, screening results summary, risk assessment, adjudication decision (favorable/unfavorable), basis for decision, adjudicator signature, date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires assessment of 'conduct, integrity, judgment, loyalty, reliability, and stability' necessitating documented adjudication of screening results

executionEvidence.name: Periodic Rescreening Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: employees requiring rescreening, rescreening trigger (time-based, position change, incident), rescreening completion date, results, adjudication
executionEvidence.frequency: Per defined intervals (typically 5-7 years for moderate positions)
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.09.01.b requires rescreening per organization-defined conditions; federal guidelines suggest 5-year intervals for moderate-risk positions

executionEvidence.name: Position Sensitivity Designations
executionEvidence.description: List showing: all positions with CUI access, assigned sensitivity level (low/moderate/high), required screening depth, rescreening frequency, basis for designation
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires screening levels to 'reflect criteria established for the level of access required' necessitating documented position risk categorization

executionEvidence.name: Screening Exception and Waiver Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: individual granted exception, normal screening requirement, exception granted, compensating controls, approval authority, justification, expiration date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates formal approval process when full screening cannot be completed, maintaining accountability per NIST trustworthiness assessment requirement

operationalActivities: Categorize all positions by sensitivity level based on CUI access
Conduct pre-employment background checks before granting system access
Verify employment history for all candidates requiring system access
Verify education credentials for positions requiring specific qualifications
Conduct criminal history checks appropriate to position sensitivity
Conduct credit checks for positions with financial responsibilities
Perform reference checks to assess character and trustworthiness
Adjudicate screening results using documented criteria
Conduct additional screening when elevating user access privileges
Perform periodic rescreening at defined intervals (5-7 years typical)
Conduct event-triggered rescreening when security incidents occur
Conduct rescreening when employees transfer to higher sensitivity positions
Document all screening decisions and maintain audit trail
Implement compensating controls for any screening exceptions
Review and update position sensitivity designations annually

policies.name: Personnel Security Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing termination and transfer procedures, timelines for access revocation, and property retrieval requirements
policies.rationale: NIST 03.09.02 requires specific termination/transfer actions necessitating formal policy guidance on timelines and responsibilities

policies.name: Account Management Policy
policies.description: Policy defining account disablement timelines, credential revocation procedures, and access review requirements for personnel changes
policies.rationale: Control 03.09.02.a requires 'disable system access within organization-defined time period' and 'terminate or revoke authenticators' requiring formal policy

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: Policy governing access reviews during transfers and modification of access rights based on role changes
policies.rationale: Control 03.09.02.b requires 'review and confirm ongoing operational need for current access' and 'modify access authorization' for transfers

procedures.name: Employee Termination Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for terminating system access, revoking credentials, retrieving property, and conducting exit interviews
procedures.rationale: Control 03.09.02.a requires specific termination actions within defined timeframes necessitating documented checklist-driven procedure

procedures.name: Employee Transfer Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reviewing access needs when employees change positions, modifying access rights, and updating role assignments
procedures.rationale: Control 03.09.02.b requires access review and modification for transfers requiring documented procedure to ensure no inappropriate access retention

procedures.name: Exit Interview Procedure
procedures.description: Process for conducting exit interviews covering security constraints, non-disclosure obligations, and property return verification
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states 'exit interviews ensure terminated individuals understand security constraints' and provide accountability for property

procedures.name: Security Property Retrieval Procedure
procedures.description: Process for identifying, tracking, and retrieving all security-related property including tokens, keys, badges, manuals, and devices
procedures.rationale: Control 03.09.02.a.3 requires 'retrieve security-related system property' and NIST discussion lists specific items requiring retrieval

procedures.name: Immediate Termination Procedure
procedures.description: Process for high-risk terminations (cause, security incident) including pre-notification account disabling and supervised exit
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states 'timely execution of termination actions is essential for individuals terminated for cause' and suggests pre-notification disabling

executionEvidence.name: Account Termination Tickets
executionEvidence.description: IT tickets showing: terminated employee name, termination date, account disable date and time, authenticators revoked (password, MFA, tokens), ticket completion date, verification signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.09.02.a.1 requires disable access 'within organization-defined time period' with 24 hours being industry best practice for immediate termination risk mitigation

executionEvidence.name: Exit Interview Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Forms showing: employee name, termination date, exit interview date, security topics discussed (non-disclosure, future employment limits, CUI obligations), property return verified, signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires exit interviews to 'ensure terminated individuals understand security constraints' though acknowledges some unavoidable exceptions

executionEvidence.name: Property Retrieval Checklists
executionEvidence.description: Checklists showing: employee name, items retrieved (authentication tokens, access badges, keys, building passes, laptops, phones, manuals), retrieval date, condition, signature of receiver
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.09.02.a.3 requires 'retrieve security-related system property' with NIST discussion listing specific items requiring documented return

executionEvidence.name: Transfer Access Review Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: employee name, old position/role, new position/role, access review date, old access rights reviewed, new access needs determined, access modifications made, approver signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Control 03.09.02.b requires 'review and confirm ongoing operational need' and 'modify access authorization' when personnel transfer positions

executionEvidence.name: Terminated Employee Access Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Monthly reports showing: all terminations in period, verification that system access was disabled, verification that physical access was revoked, verification that no CUI access remains, exceptions noted
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing verification that termination procedures were properly executed and no unauthorized access persists as required by control

executionEvidence.name: Former Employee Access Retention Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: terminated employee name, organizational data requiring retention (emails, files, work products), retention justification, access restrictions, retention period, disposal date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion mentions need to 'retain access to information formerly controlled by terminated individual' for continuity while restricting direct employee access

physicalEvidence.name: Physical Access Badge Retrieval Logs
physicalEvidence.description: Logs showing: employee name, badge ID, return date, badge status (returned/lost/destroyed), verification signature, physical access system deactivation confirmation
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly mentions 'identification cards and building passes' as security property requiring retrieval; physical access control is part of control scope per discussion text

physicalEvidence.name: Physical Key and Lock Combination Return Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Records showing: employee name, keys/combinations issued, return date, locks requiring re-keying or combination changes, completion verification
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly lists 'keys' and 'building passes' as property requiring retrieval; control scope includes physical access authorizations per requirement 03.09.02.b.1

operationalActivities: Disable all system accounts within 24 hours of termination notification (immediately for cause terminations)
Revoke all authenticators (passwords, MFA tokens, certificates) for terminated employees
Revoke physical access badges and building access within 24 hours of termination
Retrieve hardware tokens, smart cards, and authentication devices
Retrieve physical access badges, keys, and building passes
Retrieve company laptops, phones, and mobile devices
Retrieve system administration manuals and sensitive documentation
Conduct exit interviews with terminated employees when possible
Review security obligations and non-disclosure requirements during exit interview
Review access needs for all employee transfers to different positions
Modify system access rights to match new role requirements for transfers
Remove old role-based access that is no longer needed after transfer
Update physical access authorizations for employees transferring to new facilities
Issue new identification badges when employees transfer to new departments
Change lock combinations and re-key locks after terminations of personnel with physical access
Retain access to former employee work products with appropriate restrictions
Verify monthly that all recent terminations have access properly disabled
Consider pre-notification account disabling for high-risk terminations
